body: @zcbenz, could this issue be a result of [this](https://github.com/atom/electron/commit/0ab32bfe17c81a03c91f79088e71f6c58b2306fb) commit?

I'm seeing something similar, but not the same and wondering if it's related.
- With a framed window on Windows 10
- Set the size to 500x500
- Measured size of browser window produced is 490x490

There's seems to be a bunch of problems with Electron's window sizing on Windows.
Another issue I encountered is that if you create a frameless, resizable window and you maximize it, the sizing you get on a FHD screen is 1938x1050. So the width is 18 pixels longer than the actual screen width (FHD resolution is 1920x1080) and the height is about 20 pixels too much when you take into account that the taskbar height is about 46-50 pixels.

In your case did you set a min-width and/or min-height? If you remove those limits, does it change anything?

Issue #2714 is probably also somewhat related to this.
